bibl.title: George Woodard v. Territory of Washington. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Territory of Washington

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Spokane WT
To any constable and the keeper of the jail of said county

Where as George Woodard has been brought this day before the undersigned justices of the peace in and for said county charged in the oath of B.J. Richairdson, with having on the 5th day of July 1887 in said county committed the offence of unlawfully selling intoxicating liquor in the precinct of Spangle in said county and in the progress of the trial of said charged it appearing to the said justice that the said George Woodard here was guilty of the ofence of unlawfully selling intoxicating liquor commited at the time and place of foresaid, and whereas the said George Woodard has failed to give bail in the sum of five hundred dollars for his appearance at the next term of the district court or by me therfore in the name of
the Unite States you are commanded. That necessary and proper assistance to recive the said George Woodard into your custory in said jail and him time safely keep until be be discharded by ue process of law Given under my hand this 6th day of July 1887
